title: Venezuela’s Supreme Court orders Delcy Rodriguez become interim president
byline: The Constitutional Chamber of Venezuela’s Supreme Court ordered on Saturday that Vice President Delcy Rodríguez assume the role of acting president of the country in the absence of Nicolás Maduro, who was detained early Saturday morning in an operation by U.S. forces.

title: Former Sathosa Transport Manager arrested by FCID
byline: Former Sathosa Transport Manager Indika Ratnamalala has been arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) in connection with the alleged misuse of a company-owned lorry.

title: After Mustafizur’s IPL exit, Bangladesh wants its T20 World Cup games out of India
byline: Bangladesh’s interim government has instructed the Bangladesh Cricket Board to seek a change of venue for the team’s matches at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, requesting that they be moved out of India.

title: Trump says U.S. will run Venezuela after U.S. captures Maduro
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he was putting Venezuela under temporary American control after the United States captured President Nicolas Maduro in an audacious raid and whisked him to New York to face drug-trafficking charges.

title: Private airline employee arrested for smuggling jewellery, gold
byline: A 27-year-old private airline employee has been arrested by the Katunayake Airport Customs officials for allegedly bringing in jewellery and gold biscuits worth over Rs. 40 million into the country.

title: UN Security Council to meet Monday over US action in Venezuela
byline: The United Nations Security Council is due to meet on Monday after the U.S. attacked Venezuela and deposed its long-serving autocratic President Nicolas Maduro, a move that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres views as setting ’’a dangerous precedent.’’

title: Prime Group donates LKR 200 million to Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund
byline: Guided by a clear vision to extend value beyond business, Prime Group made a landmark contribution of LKR 200 million to the Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund, pledging support toward the national recovery from Cyclone Ditwah. This is believed to be one of the highest contributions made by a corporate body thus far. As a company, Prime believes it is their duty to contribute and assist the nation in times of distress.

title: Four suspects arrested over Kohuwala shooting
byline: Four suspects have been arrested in connection with a shooting incident reported in Kohuwala, police said.

title: FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 opens at Cinnamon Life
byline: FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 was officially inaugurated at Cinnamon Life - The City of Dreams, marking a significant milestone for Asia’s premier gem and jewellery exhibition. Now in its 33rd edition, the exhibition opens with a bold, future-focused vision that celebrates Sri Lanka’s rich gem heritage while positioning the industry for its next phase of global growth.

title: Venezuela’s Supreme Court orders Delcy Rodriguez become interim president
byline: The Constitutional Chamber of Venezuela’s Supreme Court ordered on Saturday that Vice President Delcy Rodríguez assume the role of acting president of the country in the absence of Nicolás Maduro, who was detained early Saturday morning in an operation by U.S. forces.

title: After Mustafizur’s IPL exit, Bangladesh wants its T20 World Cup games out of India
byline: Bangladesh’s interim government has instructed the Bangladesh Cricket Board to seek a change of venue for the team’s matches at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, requesting that they be moved out of India.

title: Communist Party condemns US strike on Venezuela, capture of its President, First Lady
byline: The Communist Party of Sri Lanka (CPSL) expressed its strongest condemnation of the abduction of President of the Bolivarian Republic  Venezuela Nicolás Maduro and his wife by the United States.

title: US action on Venezuela cannot be approved: Rajitha
byline: Action by the United States to invade Venezuela cannot be approved by anyone, a prominent member of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s camp said today.

title: JVP condemns US military aggression against Venezuela
byline: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) strongly condemned the United States of America’s military aggression against the independent and sovereign state of Venezuela and the abduction of democratically elected President Nicholas Maduro and his wife.

title: Bangladesh say they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India
byline: Bangladesh will not play their Twenty20 World Cup matches in India after Mustafizur Rahman was released by his Indian Premier League team amid growing tensions between the countries, Bangladesh’s cricket board (BCB) said on Sunday.

title: Indian Army Chief to visit Sri Lanka to strengthen defence ties
byline: General Upendra Dwivedi, Chief of the Army Staff (COAS), will visit the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Sri Lanka from January 5 to 8 as part of India’s continued engagement to strengthen defence cooperation and military-to-military ties with friendly foreign countries.

title: Namal urges education minister to resign over controversial module
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has called for Education Minister Harini Amarasuriya to resign over the controversial Grade 6 English module, stating that the responsibility lies with her rather than any ministry official.

title: Australian journalist robbed in Unawatuna; Suspect arrested
byline: The Unawatuna Tourist Police have arrested a suspect in connection with the theft of a handbag belonging to an Australian journalist near a restaurant along the Unawatuna beach.

title: Internal committee submits report on Grade 6 textbook module
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said the internal committee appointed to review the controversial Grade 6 textbook module has submitted its report.

title: OUSL hosts world’s first carbon-neutral convocation
byline: The Open University of Sri Lanka (OUSL) made history by organizing the world’s first carbon-neutral university convocation during its General Convocation 2025 (I) recently at the BMICH, Colombo.
